name: Bean Fritters
description: Ten bean fritters made from mashed kidney beans mixed with rice and glutinous rice flour. Served with garlic and cilantro sauce.

name: Mont Lin Maya
description: Called 'husband and wife snack', these seven crisp, round savory pancakes are made with a batter consisting of rice flour, quail eggs, chickpeas, and spring onions, fried in a special metal pan.

name: La Phet Thote
description: A beloved Burmese pastime food, this tea leaf salad is served with tomatoes, fried garlic slices, pumpkin seeds, and peanuts.

name: Chickpea Tofu Fritters
description: Seven tofu fritters that are crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside. Served with garlic and cilantro sauce.

name: Ohn No Khao Swe
description: Coconut noodle soup made with wheat noodles in a curried chicken and coconut milk broth thickened with gram flour and garnished with shallots, boiled eggs, cilantro, and lime.

name: Mohinga
description: Rice noodle and fish soup made with gram flour, garlic, shallots, ginger, lemongrass, fish paste, fish sauce, and catfish. Garnished with shallots, cilantro, and boiled eggs.

name: Nan Gyi Thoke
description: Thick and round rice noodles tossed in a rich, nutty dressing made with very fine powder of toasted chickpeas, fragrant red oil filtered from a curry chicken, fish sauce and lime juice.

name: Shan Noodles
description: Chicken tomato sauce served over a bed of sticky rice noodle garnished with garlic, chilli and pickle toppings.

name: Sanwin Makin
description: A traditional Burmese dessert made with semolina, condensed milk, butter, coconut milk, and poppy seeds. Garnished with coconut shavings.

name: Htoe Mont
description: A glutinous rice cake cooked with raisins, cashews and coconut shavings.

name: Bein Mont
description: Rice flour Burmese pancakes garnished with coconut shavings, sesame, peanut, and poppy seeds. Served with jaggery syrup.

name: Shwe Yin Aye
description: Sweetened coconut milk served with sticky rice, sago pearls, pandan jelly noodles, coconut jelly, and white bread.
